metadata.Title: CVE-2013-6410 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.Description:
nbd-server in Network Block Device (nbd) before 3.5 does not properly checkIP addresses, which might allow remote attackers to bypass intended accessrestrictions via an IP address that has a partial match in the authfileconfiguration file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-6410` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

nbd-client - 1:3.7-1
nbd-server - 1:3.7-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: nbd package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:3.7-1').
